title: Heat's Tyler Herro breaks hand diving for loose ball, still manages to put up shot
description: Miami Heat guard Tyler Herro broke his hand while diving for a loose ball in the second quarter against the Milwaukee Bucks, but he managed to put up a shot anyway.

title: Declaration of Independence 'rings hollow' amidst GOP pro-life laws: MSNBC anchor
description: MSNBC host Jonathan Capehart suggested that recent legislation passed by the Republican Party makes the Declaration of Independence “rings hollow" regarding freedoms.

title: Alabama mass shooting: Police confirm four dead, 28 injured; no word on suspects
description: Alabama Law Enforcement Agency officials confirmed that four people were killed and 28 others injured during a mass shooting in Dadeville on Saturday night; no word on suspects.

title: Leonardo DiCaprio spotted at Coachella with another leading man's ex-girlfriend
description: "Titanic" actor Leonardo DiCaprio only had eyes for supermodel Irina Shayk at the star-studded Neon Carnival Coachella party in Indio, California, Saturday.

title: Bucks' Giannis Antetokounmpo forced out of playoff game after hard fall on back
description: Milwaukee Bucks star Giannis Antetokounmpo was forced out of the team's Game 1 matchup against the Miami Heat on Sunday with a lower-back contusion.

title: Off-duty US Navy sailors help passengers after Washington state ferry's generator fails, runs aground
description: A group of U.S. Navy sailors headed to the Submarine Ball in Seattle assisted passengers on the halted Walla Walla ferry that ran aground near Bainbridge Island on Saturday.

title: Michigan mill worker dies from fungal outbreak of blastomycosis: 'Deeply saddened'
description: A contract worker at the Billerud Paper Mill in Escanaba, Michigan, has died from an ongoing fungal outbreak that may have infected nearly 100 employees with blastomycosis.

title: Family of ‘Fiddler on the Roof’ star Chaim Topol claim actor worked with Mossad
description: The family of the late Chaim Topol, the actor best-known for his role in "Fiddler on the Roof," has made some surprising claims about the actor being engaged in espionage in a new interview.

title: Kyle Kirkwood picks up first IndyCar win after sitting on pole at Long Beach
description: Kyle Kirkwood started the Grand Prix of Long Beach on the pole and finished in Victory Lane on Sunday. It was his first career IndyCar victory.

title: Trevor Bauer makes first pitching appearance in Japan after MLB suspension
description: Trevor Bauer pitched four innings for the Yokohama BayStars' minor league team on Sunday — his first pitching appearance since he was suspended by MLB in 2021.

title: Kyle Larson holds off Joey Logano at Martinsville
description: Kyle Larson was able to push his way past Joey Logano and hold off the defending Cup champion at Martinsville to win the race Sunday.

title: Florida woman who stole $2.8 million from Holocaust survivor in romance scam pleads guilty
description: A Florida woman who swindled $2.8 million out of an 87-year-old Holocaust survivor in a romance scam pleaded guilty on Friday to one count of wire fraud, prosecutors announced.

title: LeBron James, Lakers take down Grizzlies in Game 1 of matchup
description: The Los Angeles Lakers took down the Memphis Grizzlies in Game 1 of the first round of the NBA Playoffs as LeBron James dropped 21 points to help his team to victory.

title: Washington bill to allow medical transgender interventions on minors without parental consent
description: A Washington bill that would restrict parents' rights to be notified about their children being housed in a shelter and consent to medical care passed the Senate

title: Lakers' Anthony Davis appears to injure arm in Game 1 vs Grizzlies, comes back to play crucial role in win
description: Los Angeles Lakers forward Anthony Davis appeared to suffer an arm injury in the team's win against the Memphis Grizzlies on Sunday. But he came back in and played a major role.

title: Grizzlies star Ja Morant suffers gruesome hand injury in Game 1 loss to Lakers
description: Memphis Grizzlies star Ja Morant had to leave Game 1 against the Los Angeles Lakers early on Sunday afternoon after suffering a right hand injury in the fourth quarter.

title: Gay couple in New York City attacked, beaten in Times Square
description: A gay couple who was visiting Times Square in New York City was targeted and beaten by at least four suspects last Saturday. One of the victims needed to get jaw surgery.

title: Minnesota deputy shot and killed while responding to domestic incident: 'lost a brother'
description: Pope County, Minnesota deputy Josh Owen was shot and killed on Saturday night after responding to a domestic incident at a home in Cyrus.

title: Coachella 2023: Kourtney Kardashian, Emma Roberts, K-Pop's Blackpink, models and more celeb festival fashion
description: The hottest celebrities sizzled underneath the desert sun for the Coachella Valley Music and Arts Festival 2023 and flaunted their best fashionable outfits.

title: Buttigieg points to how roads are 'designed and built' as the reason for racial disparities in road fatalities
description: Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg reiterated his focus on combatting racial disparities roadway fatalities on “PoliticsNation with Al Sharpton" on Saturday.

title: North Carolina archeologists, Waccamaw Siouan Tribe discover 930-year-old Native American canoe in lake
description: North Carolina archeologists, volunteers and the Waccamaw Siouan Tribe joined together to pull a 930-year-old canoe out of Lake Waccamaw, which will be sent to Greenville for research.

title: Italian soccer star injured in car-tram collision expected to miss time
description: Italian soccer star Ciro Immobile was involved in a car crash with a tram on Sunday morning, suffering a "compound fracture" in his right rib among other injuries.

title: Bodycam footage shows police fatally shoot armed homeowner after responding to wrong house
description: The Farmington, New Mexico, police department released bodycam footage showing the fatal shooting of a homeowner afterofficers responded to the wrong house.

title: California elementary teacher allegedly molested students for years: police
description: Second grade elementary school teacher Jeremy Yeh was arrested for allegedly sexually abusing students at Allen Elementary School and El Crystal Elementary School in San Bruno.

title: Maryland police find body amid search for 10-year-old autistic girl
description: Charles County Sheriff's Office found a body in a quarry in the search for Maryland child Maddelynn Wallace, an autistic and non-verbal girl who went missing from her Waldorf home.

title: 'Chicago Fire's' Taylor Kinney supports veterans at first event after taking 'leave of absence' from show
description: Taylor Kinney attended the MotoGP races at the Circuit of the Americas in Austin, Texas, and supported MotoUp, a nonprofit benefitting military service members.

title: Ivy League university moves to prioritize 'free expression' months after students heckled conservative pundit
description: Cornell University unveiled plans to use 'free expression and academic freedom' as its theme for the 2023-2024 year on Friday, following student pushes to censor conservatives.

title: DeAndre Hopkins reacts to possible trade destinations amid Cardinals rumors
description: Arizona Cardinals wide receiver DeAndre Hopkins has been rumored to be moved this offseason, and he has an idea of teams he does, and doesn't, want to be traded to.

title: United Nations calls for halt to Sudan violence after three aid workers and dozens of others are killed

title: Senate Dems put on the spot, asked directly if Sen. Feinstein should step down

description: New images of Ariana Grande and Cynthia Erivo's characters in the upcoming big screen adaptation of "Wicked" have been released by the film's director, John M. Chu.

title: Florida man robs arcade with BB gun before getting shot and fleeing: police
description: Clewiston, Florida police arrested a man on Saturday who allegedly robbed an arcade before he was shot by an armed security guard, and fled the scene.

title: Texas teen dies rock climbing, two hours later he revives: 'A literal miracle'
description: A Texas teen went rock climbing, suffered cardiac arrest, and was pronounced dead by paramedics. Two hours later he was alive with minimal brain trauma.

title: Dem lawmaker opposing TikTok ban claims it's 'better, more educational' than Instagram, Facebook, Twitter
description: Democratic Rep. Jamaal Bowman claimed on Sunday that TikTok is a "better product" than Facebook, Instagram or Twitter during an interview with Jen Psaki.

title: Brewers' Gus Varland avoids major injury after getting hit in face by line drive
description: Brewers rookie reliever Gus Varland was able to walk off on his own power after being hit in the hand and face by a 105.1 mph line drive on Saturday.

title: Wedding party problem: 'Self-centered' woman bans her boyfriend from attending a bachelor party
description: A couple's dilemma has more than 5,000 reactions on social media: A young woman is banning her boyfriend from attending his good pal's bachelor party due to a prior commitment on her end.

title: GOP rep. lauds CCP's sanctions on him as a 'badge of honor'
description: Rep. Michael McCaul joined "Sunday Morning Futures" to react to the sanctions placed on him by the Chinese Communist Party.

title: Former Indian politician linked to organized crime gunned down on live television

title: NYPD commish admits 'people taking advantage' of bail reform, laments city's 'perception of feeling unsafe'
description: NYPD Commissioner Keechant Sewell stressed that although homicides and shooting are "down by the double digits" in New York City, the "perception of feeling unsafe" remains.

description: Atlanta Braves manager Brian Snitker was ejected from Friday night's game against the Kansas City Royals for arguing a judgment call from the umpires.

description: The U.S. Coast Guard and local vessels responded to Rich Passage near Bainbridge Island, Washington, after a ferry with nearly 600 passengers ran aground Saturday.

title: Intel officials fear US won't be able to see a Taiwan invasion coming, leaked docs show

description: The U.S. fears it will not be able to identify the early warning signs of a Chinese invasion of Taiwan, according to a trove of Pentagon documents leaked online.

title: Wyoming news site finds more than a third of small-town bars surveyed are experiencing Bud Light boycotts

description: The Chicago White Sox won in walk-off fashion on Saturday in 10 innings, but a bunch of people didn't see it because they got into a brawl.

title: Health surprise: Hibernating bears may help us beat blood clots, says new research
description: Research shows that hibernating bears prevent blood clots by keeping a low level of a key protein in their blood. Experts are hopeful that future medications may help prevent blood clots in humans.

description: Why these seven words of sympathy after a tragedy deserve our praise not scorn. Caring is important but we must do more after a horrible incident.

description: Glenda and Saturn, two young kittens who are best friends and a bonded pair, are looking for a new home. They live in a foster house in Maryland; Glenda is blind.

description: A mass shooting at a birthday party in Dadeville, Alabama, on Saturday left multiple people dead. Police have not said if a suspect has been arrested.

title: On this day in history, April 16, 1889, future Hollywood legend Charlie Chaplin is born in London
description: Actor and producer Charlie Chaplin was born on this day in history, April 16, 1889, in London. He went on to perfect and refine the character Charlie the Tramp — and was knighted in 1975.
